# Scale: Harmonic in B (Mode: Locrian #6, Shape: G)

## Brief Presentation
The Harmonic scale in B, also known as the Locrian #6 mode in the key of B, with the shape of G, is a unique and distinct musical scale that provides a mysterious and exotic sound. It is an uncommon scale but offers intriguing harmonic possibilities for musicians looking to create tension in their compositions.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- C (Minor 2nd)
- D (Minor 3rd)
- E (Perfect 4th)
- F (Diminished 5th)
- G (Major 6th) - Locrian #6 characteristic note
- A# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Harmonic scale in B with the Locrian #6 mode and the shape of G is often used in jazz, fusion, and experimental music genres. It provides a dark, mysterious, and slightly dissonant flavor due to the flat fifth and major sixth intervals. This scale is ideal for creating tension-filled compositions and adding a unique twist to musical arrangements.
